result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan D. Dwyer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case - Dismissed and read in.
And order for other prosecution costs in the amount of $1853.00  to be paid during probation on  file 13-CF-334.
of disposition of case; deft released from custody as to this file only.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court reinstates bond, does not enter judgment on bond forfeiture.  Court orders extradition costs of $1,853 (by stipulation of deft), to be collected during probation in 13CF334.  On State's motion, this case is dismissed and read in for sentencing in file 13CF334.
Extradition costs in the amount of $1853.00
Extradition costs in the amount of $1853.00

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  STC set for 6/25/15 at 2:30pm; issue of bond forfeiture to be addressed on this date.  Bond continued.

1:21 pm    Atty Jerrold Hinshaw appeared as Special Prosecutor for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carl Johnson.  Clerk: LE.  Referred to Br. 6 for further disposition on 6-1-15 @ 3:30 pm - Sentencing.  $1000 cash bond set with same conditions.  Warrant vacated

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.
961.41(3g)(am) Poss of Narcotic Drugs   /   946.49(1)(b) Fel BJ
Warrant served, def. in custody.  Return on warrant today at 1:00 before Intake Commissioner.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Atty K Watson appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson states the deft left her a message stating he did not believe he would make it here from AZ.  Court issues warrant $10,000 cash bond, bond forfeiture remains.
to cancel warrant.
Vacated with Alma in Records.
Atty Watson submitted confirmation letter showing that the deft is in treatment in AZ; per Judge Wagner the warrant is vacated; FPT set over to 4/24/15 at 8:45am.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Atty K Watson appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson states the deft is in treatment in AZ.  Court forfeits bond and issues warrant $10,000 cash bond.

With Atty Rufo and by agreement of ADA Delgado the FPT of 11/24/14 at 8:45am is rescheduled, as the deft is in an inpatient treatment facility in AZ until at least mid-January; reset to 2/18/15 at 8:30am.
Per Atty Watson, def. is still in in-patient treatment in Mesa, Arizona.  Pretrial on 10/13/14 changed to 11/24/14 at 8:45.  OK with ADA Delgado.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
With Atty Watson the FPT of 9/5/14 at 8:15am is rescheduled, as the deft is still in inpatient treatment; reset to 10/13/14 at 8:30am and DA PTC 9/19/14 at 1:30pm.

With Atty Watson and ADA Burgoyne the FPT of 7/25/14 at 11am is rescheduled, as the deft is in an inpatient treatment facility in Lake Villa, IL and his counselor confirmed that with Atty Watson; reset to 9/5/14 at 8:15am.
Executed search warrant filed on 3-14-14 transfered from 14GF4000X  PPPD 13-18441
with Atty Watson the FPT of 7/1/14 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, as she is unavailable; reset to 7/25/14 at 11am.
with Atty Watson and ADA Burgoyne the FPT of 5/2/14 at 9:15am is rescheduled, to allow them time to resolve this case; reset to 7/1/14 at 1:15pm.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  FPT 5/2/14 at 9:15am.  Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing

Defendant, Ryan D. Dwyer, appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 6.  Information filed, reading waived. Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Filed by Atty:  K Watson.
